result.execSummary:
The defendant Tywann R. Lott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tywann R. Lott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tywann R. Lott was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with EDT (dot 12/10/97), unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tywann R. Lott appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth. Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for two (2) years w/conditions. No sentence credit. Court costs ordered. No restitution requested. Appeal rights given.

records.addlTxt: of dispo
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Amended Info

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to count 3 as amended; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 6/29/15 @ 3pm.
Plea hrg today rescheduled to 5/20/15 @ 1pm; defense counsel in trial in another branch
Plea hearing on May 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
immediately following the hrg, Atty Barth reported the case was settled.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Final offer just relayed today; defense requests a short adjournment in order for the deft to think about the offer.  Per Court, leave on for JS for 5/11/15.  Parties to notify the court by 5pm on 5/6/15 if the case is settled.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ due to ongoing jury trial.  Atty Barth reports the case is settled.  Plea hrg set for 4/30/15 @ 11am
Scheduling Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth (who was late).  FPT 4/2/15 @ 11am, JS 5/11/15 @ 9am along w/co-deft cases (14CF1275, 14CF1328, 14CF1327).  Scheduling order provided to the attys.

134 p.m.  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clk  LE.  Referred to Br 3 for further dispo on 2/19/15 @ 9 a.m. - FPT  Not Guilty plea entered. Jury Selection 3/9/15 @ 9 a.m.  with Co deft in 14-CF-1327.   Bond - continued.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Barth. Not acted upon pending co-def. filing one.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Michael Barth. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Information filed. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed. Court does not act on substitution pending co-def.'s filing of RFS. Atty. Barth requests arraignment be adjourned. Arraignment on 12-14-14 @ 1:00pm with co-def. Atty. Barth moves to amend bond. State waives notice requirement, but opposes modification. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
